Package betsy.grammar

Has classes used for interpreting the grammar of a sentence, the meanings of words or phrases in a sentence, and for reconstructing sentences.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    SentenceConstructor
    SentenceConstructors take a tree of StructureTags and turn them back into a human-readable sentence.
    SentenceStructureParser
    A SentenceStructureParser takes a tree of Tags generated by an English language parser like the Stanford Parser, and turns it into a tree of StructureTags, which have clearer rules about how they are laid out (see the StructureTag class) and provide more details on the functions of each phrase in the sentence.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    RecursiveSentenceConstructor
    An implementation of a SentenceConstructor.
    RecursiveStructureParser
    An implementation of SentenceStructureParser.
    TokenUtils
    Utilities for working with Tokens.
    WordTree<T>
    A WordTree is used to group and arrange strings in a tree structure.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    StructureTag
    Trees of StructureTags are used to describe a sentence.
    StructureTag.CategoryTag
    CategoryTags are used to categorize StructureTags.
    Tag
    Tags used by Penn Treebank to categorize words and phrases in a sentence.
    Tag.StructuralType  
    Tag.WordType  

Package betsy.grammar Description

Has classes used for interpreting the grammar of a sentence, the meanings of words or phrases in a sentence, and for reconstructing sentences. It has the WordTree and StructureTag class, which together are used as Betsy's internal model for phrases.
Author:
jacob
